In this work, we propose a deterministic decision tree-based
algorithm to automatically extract football events using tracking data, which
consists of two steps: (1) a possession step that evaluates which player was in
possession of the ball at each frame in the tracking data, as well as the
distinct player configurations during the time intervals where the ball is not
in play to inform set piece detection; (2) an event detection step that
combines the changes in ball possession computed in the first step with the
laws of football to determine in-game events and set pieces

The proposed model demonstrated the power of GNN in the
football game by outperforming other DRL models with significantly fewer steps
